page.title: 01General Synopsis of the Area
page.content:
This area is part of the eastern outskirts of the{City of Coventry. }
Running through it West-East is the A427 main road to Rugby. The main Coventry to London railway line follows the same route. The city boundary runs North-South and cuts the area into two distinct parts. Outside the city boundary i.e. the eastern part of the area, it is countryside with a number of small wooded areas, a small dormitory housing estate,a farm and a small part of a much larger Country Park called Coombe Abbey. Within the boundary lie dense housing estates, Willenhall to the South, Ernesford Grange, and Binley to the North whilst to the North West, separated by the River Sowe and its wide flood plain are the areas of Wyken and Stoke.
